QbCJJ8QusCEJJJ0rD9P_Lg.text: First the food is good, overpriced but good. The thing about this place is that it is beyond poorly managed. You have kids running the place. People overflowing into the street at times because of no parking space. Only guys working it seems are the valets and the slow A** cooks. So as we all stand with infant children to be seated there are 3 booths open but reserved. WHAT? for 25 minutes we stand and and these booths are empty? The 2 girls seating people are maybe 16 and have no idea what is happening. No name tags,no uniforms. a customer has no idea they even work at this place. Then when finally seated they can't get us a high chair because the 2 available have broken safety straps, can you say LAWSUIT! All the other high chairs are being used because they have to use two at a time to boost the chair high enough so the baby can almost reach the tables which are all to high. All the waiting staff is comprised of kids who have no idea about anything you ask. And another thing. Happy Hour is available if you stay on the other side of the restaurant which is standing room only. Who ever heard of such a thing? Yes this is the Arcadia Tavern and yes we have a  Happy Hour but your 10 feet to far over in the restaurant. This was my 4th and LAST time in this place. Food is good but no need to stroke-out because the idiot running the place has no idea how to treat people!

04YzXrbnBuNhstYMCoT-4Q.text: Comfortable atmosphere, nice menu.  Seared ahi salad was good.

igvs2atZJMpqGKQtn11t6w.text: I agree with the above comment. I live in the neighborhood as well and was very excited to see Arcadia Tavern open, hoping it would still have the neighborhood charm of Western Pizza and Red Tomato. I was wowed by the size of the place and the number of flat screens, but unfortunately the food and service were so so. I've tried to go back several times but each time the parking lot is packed and there's no space at the adjacent lots. Who exactly is filling up these spaces??? The restaurant never looks busy from the outside...Due to the lack of parking at Arcadia I found myself ending up at Blackforest Mill and Jts. Both of which I have found to have great food and great drink prices. So to those who will probably venture to Arcadia Grill like I did and be turned away by lack of parking, head over to one of these bars instead. I think you will be pleasantly surprised by the food and drinks.

dil11l9HI48S-ApWXwvupg.text: So the boys were out for an afternoon of bike riding and drinking, and my beau called me and wanted me to come join them at their last stop for a drink. When I ordered a drink, the waitress informs me that Chili's has a better beer (both on tap and in the bottle) selection than they do; I settled for a jameson on the rocks. It was getting later in the afternoon so I browsed their menu and found that Chili's has better pricing for the same pre-frozen-heated-in-a-fryer food. I order some tots and another jameson to tide me over. I was right, the tots were frozen but the Arcadia Tavern had put regular pepper on them to make them fancy.  As I was ending my second drink and eating some ice, I got a very nasty surprise. There was GLASS mixed in with my ice! It cut open my mouth on two different spots and I left the bar with a bleeding mouth.  All the manager offered us was free drink tickets. That was really lame. Bad customer service and poor beer selection and over priced food means we will not be going back.

7967Ll9oBVdTEYqirbdgWQ.text: i love sports but never used to go to sports bars because of the horrible cigarette smoke that would waft all over the place. now, with new laws in place, i ventured out with a red sox arizona group to watch the greatest team in baseball humiliate the skankees.  and what i discovered is that the arcadia tavern is a go-to place for great company and suprisingly great food. i expected the usual burger and chicken sandwiches to dominate the menu, but was pleasently surprised by the diversity. they have great shrimp dishes, pizzas, incredible nachos, seared ahi tuna and much more. if you are burger person, they are huge, constructed in just about any way you want it, even with an egg! they have messy ribs,and until recently featured a huge high quality steak dinner.  you just have to google the place to see the entire menu. the service is great, and the bartender mike, is a red sox fan! they have beers on tap but unfortunately does not include sam adams. though you can get the boston lager in a bottle. they even have huge ice cream desserts, ranging from root beer floats, sundaes, and a decadent ice cream and cooke that you have to see to believe. kids are welcome, since there is such an emphasis on food that it's hard to imagine it as a sports bar. but it most definitely is...also serving as the football new orleans saints bar, when they serve items like gumbo and jambalaya.  again, bar food is not my forte, but i never turn down a chance to watch the sox with a great group of fans, in a venue that acting more like a neighborhood go to place than a bar which has high standards.

POijHBveoZYw89zWkhdRdg.text: It's alright. I like the atmosphere a lot. The patio rocks. My margarita and my sandwich were okay. Nothing too exciting or spectacular, but good. My dads fish and chips looked good. Area is really nice.

6TRkouvkyM2qib1f-Yi-5A.text: I live in the neighborhood so it's convenient & one can get a beer with their burger. When they opened several years ago I was excited to have a sports bar in the neighborhood. It's actually a pretty good place to meet a buddy for a couple beers. But, after numerous visits over several years I can honestly say that Arcadia Tavern is consistently disappointing. The food has always been mediocre at best - maybe a little better than Buffalo Wild Wings or Zipps - the service is always slow & I've also always noticed the staff to be condescendingly rude like they're doing me a favor with their presence. The only reason I've eaten here as many times as I have is that it's close to home but every time I've eaten there I've left feeling disappointed.   This is food and atmosphere for U of A people by U of A people with valet parking...

N_L0sMXY1X2uV8LcM04POg.text: Use to love Arcadia Tavern! After my take-out order this evening I won't be returning anytime soon. Food was very disappointing and pricing was steep. I don't mind the $$ if the food is good.

fP6bLpQya3F_PPjf_lGlXg.text: I absolutely love this place and wished I loved closer so I could frequent this place more often. I met a friend here for happy hour and it was exactly as I remembered it. The happy hour is decent and is Monday to Friday from 4-7pm. The sangria was delicious as was the hummus that we shared. Instead of sharing a bunch of appetizers, we decided to order off the "Light Entrees" portion of the happy hour menu. There is nothing light about these! For the price, the burger was huge and the chicken caesar salad was as well. Both were wonderful. Highly recommend this place!

Yksb_S0MmzXv_fOd2WoGQg.text: Arcadia Tavern is always fun. Its a great spot for Sunday football (and Funday). My girlfirend and I recently went after a hike and it was packed. The owner was kind enough to find us a table in front of the game we wanted to watch. We had a couple beers and split a sandwich and it was awesome! Food is a good go to, the beer is always great and the atmosphere is always fun!

jAGrnvJIQVkZtMCW1ROtZA.text: Good place to watch a game and drink but the service and food aren't so great. Went there on a weekday night during happy hour and had the mozzarella sticks which were a bit cold. Had a Caesar salad and the dressing tasted to much like mayo so it was difficult to eat. Only saw our server a few times and had to ask for silverware and napkins.

MnlEj40f7nTJ9s14uPa4TA.text: University of Arizona Bar.  Don't go here. Not friendly to Sun Devils.  I'll take my dollars elsewhere.

4zXKr_n5JXksqnSsg_J7ww.text: Hey Arcadia Tavern, You're so hip and cool that you need to park my car in a spot 20 feet from where I hand you the keys. WRONG.  For some reason there are a few places in Arcadia that force you to valet your car despite being an average place where the food, prices, service, income level of customers, and parking have absolutely no need for it.  This is one of them.  Some of you are probably like: THIS DUDES A CHEAPSKATE, HE JUST DOESN'T WANT TO TIP THEM BLAH BLAH.. WRONG AGAIN. I do fit into a subset of people that are ruining the lives of homeless people everywhere (or likely improving them): I don't carry cash.  So now you're going to make me look like a cheap ass because I can't tip the 18 year old in the dirty polo who spent a whole 5 seconds coasting my car from the point where I got out of it to the parking spot 5 meters ahead.  Yeah that's right fuckers, I'm using the metric systems today. Watch what happens.  Automatic 1-point deduction for that.  I can park my own car believe it or not.  Now, some places that involve themselves with this moronic practice can get that point back later in the day by pushing my boner across the 50% hardness threshold.  NOT ARCADIA TAVERN.  I strolled in around 11am, just tryna cure a hangover with a bloody Mary, and scope this place out a little bit.  I had places to be by Noon so I figured I could get in and out of here with more than enough time. TRIPLE WRONG.  First I'm seated, 15 minutes pass, I order, 15 more minutes pass.    (at this point Yaya better be in the back picking tomatoes and distilling mash for this shit, because I could have been out the door hours ago)  OH WAIT This waitress is over here with her back to me watching TV.  Apparently she doesn't work for tips.  Guess how long it took for the bill to come.  LIGHT YEARS.  Tricked you, light years is a distance. One divided by a light year = the distance the valet had to walk to get my car an hour after arriving at this place.  Not coming back, place is a dump.

gfoZ09x57rMaNwmx3cE7Yg.text: Meh.  Food was good, service was more booty than watching Fox News.  Honestly an angry bartender equals a shitty bar. Keep your head up blondie and if patrons suck, realize why people expect you there.  Being nice w three stars btw. Lexie was rad

TdD5gtWt5JMZqt_u9B-_Dg.text: Assuming that you have the patience to deal with their insane parking lot this is one of the better watering holes in the neighborhood.  Nothing more then above average bar standards but a great environment to relax with the old pals.

MO_O6tvmMLQKPrC3mxjjRw.text: First visit was the first day of the NCAA tournament.  The owner was extremely accommodating.  It was packed by late afternoon but he worked to ensure we had a seat and let the bar attendant know we had just sat down so they could take our order.  He continuously checked on us to make sure we were doing ok.  Customer service goes a long way!  I will definitely return soon.  Oh, the food was also really good.  It isn't on the menu anymore but their buffalo chicken pizza was delish!

jtaEXK_jMccWOqAC_T92kA.text: Don't know why the corned beef sandwich is so popular. It was nasty. I was using a groupon. I do t complain when I use them since I'm getting a deal. Felt like I should have. The corned beef wash mush.

GbpqTE3E1dpHGyiKr1pbVg.text: I love this place! I'm actually a regular here. Often, friends and myself stop in after an evening workout at the gym. Great Happy Hour menu. The Buffalo Chicken Sliders and Spinach & Artichoke Dip are my faves. If you're all about Burgers, I highly recommend this place. Cheers***

l3YZx9DhF0i125WUCv25XA.text: Really amazing veggie salad.  And the toasted bread (basically bruschetta) on the happy hour menu is bomb! Especially the spinach and artichoke. The nachos are pretty good too.  Great atmosphere and location. Dog friendly patio.  Sometimes they have live music. The bar area opens up into the patio which is cool.  Lots of TVs so good for games.  Totally recommend this place!

LZ_codtdJk1vyi7hGv0YNQ.text: We ordered food delivered last night on a whim because we were looking for something new.  We ordered the Taco Pizza, and it was delicious.  Truly a nice change from regular pizza. They charge a $3.00 delivery fee, but it is totally worth it.  The food arrived fast and piping hot!  We will definitely be visiting the Restuarant in person.

Nwp4nSiHlOdoM5zi78TOaA.text: Atmosphere is always great, lots of tv's! The service is always hit or miss. I'm really writing this review for the "bottomless mimosas." By far the worst, legit no champagne....all oj. We were there for 6hrs watching football, getting refills CONSTANTLY (Duh it's bottomless) and at the end we had ZERO buzz! Super disappointing considering how many bottomless mimosas places are near by we definitely  threw our money away on this! Id rather pay a higher price for bottomless if I'm actually going to get some champagne!

z1S5VSNf-terrL1wb0_eww.text: I have been to Arcadia Tavern several times. Everytime I have been the food has been extremely good.  First time around I had the Tavern Grilled Cheese with tots. Sandwich was really nothing special, but it was grilled perfectly and the tots crunchy, crispy and not greasy. I will give that meal a C+.  Second time was for Happy Hour with some co-workers. My husband and I only had cocktails but several others ordered food. Service was very slow for drinks and food, she was nice just not on top of it. Food ordered was Spinach & Artichoke dip and Hummus & Pitas and a Tavern Burger. Food was well prepared and presentation was spot on and with a $5-$6 price tag you can't go wrong. As for the cocktails, I think $9-$12 for a martini or margarita during Happy Hour is a little overpriced.  Third time was for lunch @ about 11 on a Friday afternoon. We (4 co-workers and myself) decided to order the Salted Pretzel with Roasted Pepper Cheese...OMG. That warm soft pretzel was amazing. I literally could have eaten both of the pretzels that come with an order and died a happy woman. The cheese sauce was good but it kinda reminded me of chili cheese. For my entree I had the Phoenix Philly with Sweet Tots. The taste was wonderful, the perfect amount of spice. My complaint was the sandwich was dry and could have used a touch more shaved prime rib and a little more cheese would have made up for the dryness. The sweets tots could have been left to fry a touch more for they were not crisp enouch for my liking, but again the taste was great.  Co-workers had burgers, Hangover and Rocky Point. All said they were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Waitress was nice and got our order correct. The bus boy was great, we never had a dirty dish and he is the one that actually brought our food, both the pretzel and sandwiches.  My only real complaint about Arcadia Tavern is the womens restroom. Why would you only have 1 stall? And why would you have in next to the kids area? All of those kids line up in front of the door to wait their turn to play the free video games and the door sticks, I kept thinking I was going to knock some kid out everytime I opened the door. It's Happy Hour, with beer and with beer comes...well you know. Which does bring me to another complaint. I know they have a small restaurant area separate from the bar, but come on it's still a bar. People are drinking and with drunk people comes an atmosphere I really don't want my kid in.  Prices for food are competitive and the quality is good, for 5 entrees, a appetizer and non-alcoholic beverages our total was $80.   Get the pretzel for Happy Hour its only $5..so, so worth it!

Np5W3U79lWbNBryy7SjXxw.text: Food was great and the owner was awesome. Forgot his name but he introduced himself and asked if everything was good but most importantly, he got the Blackhawks game on for me. Went here after OHSO had an 1hr 20min wait. Glad we came across this place because we'll definitely be coming back!

7SQ8wJPKUEIGRkAi-T6JAA.text: This is a great establishment with an awesome owner. My reserve unit came in for lunch and he and his stuff took great care of us. The food is always outstanding.

xvzy7AsIYjAKx_i_jHLq3A.text: Went here for lunch with my Navy unit today and Wally, the owner visited our table, thanked us, and comped our entire bill of 15 people! We were floored. The food is fantastic and Stephanie, our server was awesome! Will definitely be our regular go to place:)

xsCBsdRHQdIoli3qsM7QFQ.text: I really enjoy the atmosphere at this bar & grill. Definitely the place to go if you're in the Arcadia neighborhood.

3eosYWaZf30aDr_WBX4AZw.text: This is definitely one of the nicest sports bars I've ever been to before. They have a great patio, the best sangria I think I've ever tasted, and the Taco Pizza is to die for! The service was good, and I only have one complaint... The parking! I think it is absolutely ridiculous to offer valet parking in such a small lot with very limited parking. I hate when places do that! I will be back! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria &amp; Taco Pizza to die for!

xbH01lm9gPmmZSCpKQP8JQ.text: Amazing find!  They have a huge selection of beers on tap, that are not your typical Budweiser. Also, beers come in Schooners, which just make it more fun to drink.  The bar area can get a little cramped, but if you come to watch the game, you're in luck cause there are flat screens throughout the rest of the tavern's dining area and above the bar that can easily be seen from outside.  I recommend the spinach and artichoke dip, tater tots, steak salad (amazing) and margherita pizza. We have been here multiple times and I can't say anything bad about it!

sVYETK5YihNZ2tzLo2V1OA.text: What can I say about the Arcadia Tavern? well actually quite a bit since it is walking distance from my house. I was a little skeptical because since I have lived in the Arcadia area there have been several different establishments in the Arcadia Tavern building.   i must say when I first walked in I was shocked to see they had taken over the space next door and really opened the bar/restaurant up. It is a great place to watch a game because it's chock full of flat screens, has great beer, and bar menu. I must say that the best thing on the menu are the buffalo chicken sliders. They are a must have. So are the tater tots. Tater tots make me feel like a kid all over again....lol...I also really like the Thursday $3 Dos Equis special served in a goblet. So the good, food, drinks, atmosphere. The bad? The service is mediocre but the bar staff is cute which I guess makes up for mediocre service. Also a bit pricey, but not toooo out of line.   The Arcadia Tavern is a must visit restaurant/bar. You won't be disappointed.

YUt7_aOjFZG2JqUvJlrj5A.text: This was the kind of modern sports bar I like.  My cousin and I went here on the advice of another bar (guess not rivals down here) for us to find a Buffalo Sabres Hockey game on satellite.  Good move, the bar manager was nice and friendly and kind enough to get a feed for us to watch the hockey game.  Liked the beer, but glass was like fit for a kind -- it was huge goblet. I met the hostess/waitress and struck up a nice friendship, chatted a bit with her.   This a good place to visit on a stop in Phoenix..

t5yMvKW_XJvtNuD4ifDfbg.text: Went here for a couple beers a dinner before heading to a show -- absolutely terrible service. We walked in and decided to grab a table on the patio, where we sat unacknowledged for a good 10 minutes. Well actually that's not quite accurate -- we were given the "stink eye" by a server because apparently we committed the unforgivable sin of seating ourselves. The horror! (By the way there was no hostess nor a hostess area when we entered). When we finally received service, it was beyond slow and barely competent. We had bottled beer and when we asked for glasses, we got the "sure, I'll be right back" then sat & waited...and waited.... Then when my boyfriend approached the bartender for said glasses, he received an eye roll for his trouble. At that point we contacted the others in our party who were meeting us there that we were heading over to OHSO instead. This was my first time at Arcadia Tavern and my last.

_PDA6PzlEH8nSBEGGPcx5A.text: A little pricey, but always worth it. The food is incredible (among the top five wings in the city, as far as I'm concerned) and always fresh--a refreshing and wonderful change from typical crappy bar food. The atmosphere is clean, cool, homey and modern--and there's nothing like being served an ice-cold goblet (yes, GOBLET) of great local beer. What every friendly neighborhood bar should be.

cGD0_d0CYlEl4BT0-CmZtA.text: There are three fabulous things about Arcadia:  1) A bar that actually looks good in the daytime. The flooring was beautiful and the fabric on the chairs complemented. It was very clean. 2) Every NFL game was being shown on Sunday, including the Packers/Lions. They were even all labeled and the waitress knew exactly where each one was being shown. 3) A hard to pick just one breakfast menu. I ended up choosing the bananas foster pancakes but bird in the hole needs to be tried.   These are enough that I will probably come back at least another time, just to try the other fantastic breakfast item.. maybe dinner (which looked equally pleasing). However, there are some annoyances to be dealt with:  1) The packers/lions game was being played on the patio, which was nice. However, the sound we were receiving was from another game and was annoying. 2) The service was a little slow. Our server would frequently come out and not check on us. I almost missed the breakfast cut off time because of this. However, she did offer to split our check which was well appreciated.  3) The mimosa was huge but not very mimosa-y.  One of my friends told me there is a section in the back that has video games and a play area for kids which seems like a nice added touch also.

TyZ_jX2SmStzi3CwX7RNBQ.text: This is a great place to watch a game, there's tons of flat screen TVs and the burgers are great. Plenty of beer on tap and the staff really takes care of you. I'm definitely going to keep coming back here, I've never had a bad experience nor have my friends.

GBn9kHUr0ZeloLUjDSHvAQ.text: Amazing food! Great service. I ordered a dessert to go home and they packed the entire thing in sperate containers. Perfect!

kaaRAyixG6bA5ofjuTOmvA.text: So.... this review is going to be a bit tough to do since my memory of being here is somewhat limited but here are the highlights that equal 4 stars from this foggy girl's memory:  1.  TATE TOTS:  I ate some tater tots off my friend plate, they were good.  2.  They serve beer in these really large cool goblets.... those looked fun.  I didn't have beer but the goblets were cool to look at.  3.  Easy to find location-- this helps when vision is impaired but of course, I wasn't driving, but I did see it from the street.  4.  The Patio:  nice patio, comfortable  5.  Server seemed nice, she did bring me many glasses of water that ended up watering the gravel outside but I insisted on refills.

B68cyj35ulTiMMo6BgAMEw.text: Food:  Standard fare, nothing too inspiring, but then again, it's a Tavern.  I liked the Arcadia fries- a concept that seems to be too much for some people to handle:  A fried potato dish that eats like a nacho?  To me that's heaven.  Fried potato and Guacamole were meant to be together.  Burgers are swell... They play it safe, and for what they do, they do it well.  A tad pricey, but go during happy hour to shave a coule dollars if you're that concerned.  Drinks:  Drinks are reasonable, and for some reason, I just like drinking out of a schooner.  Well-lit, airy place, the bar setup with the TV's is a little funky- because the rail area is so narrow, you find yourself looking almost straight-up, and if you're at one of the ends, better hope your game is on one of the closest screens.  Not a big "destination", but all in all I liked it, and I live close by, so I'll be back.

cvBlzqTxBzajxDSsRWYMIw.text: Been here a few times with friends. I live not to far down the road so it is pretty convenient. Especially on the way to Old town for a quick dinner before going out on a Friday or Saturday night.   My absolute fave that I must tell everyone about it their Veggie Burger. By far the best in town. It is a little spicy buy sweet at the same time. The Best! You have to try it. They have some good aps as well, especially the veggie/hummus plate for those who are looking out for the carbs.   It is basically a tavern that has pretty decent food, big bar and lots of tv's that will be great to watch football and basketball on. I would recommend it!

pVoJU72CBPihwoq6fsSfSg.text: Let me tell you something, I have been going to Arcadia Tavern for the last 3 to 4 years, by far the best damn sports bar in town hands down!!! From the hospitailty of the staff to the basic service I have not experienced a better place. Fun atmosphere for the entire family. If you have kids they have an area for you. I suggest you come on out to the Tavern and enjoy a night of great company and spirits! Food is great at a reasonable price! They have tv's everywhere for every game, and if it's ot on, just ask and you will see it! Hats off to the Arcadia Tavern crew for making any evening enjoyable!! Will definetley recomend this place to anyone in town or coming in town! Trust me a sure hit!!!

NiEhMgzZ-SI87I0qB99vWA.text: This place is like fuckin' Romper Room with kids running all over. My lady wanted to leave after she experienced the filthy bathroom with the changing table hanging on the door but we stayed since the order was already in. It was also uncomfortably hot inside since they had half of the building open to accommodate the band which was playing way too loud. I guess 100+ at 8:00 pm means its time to open the doors and windows?   Giving two stars because the food was not terrible.  Oh, and the valet parking dudes are way too rough with the cars.  No plans to go back in this decade.

CJ49mg0MCwPj6gYPsM5ixw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!  Awesome for football and happy hour, good food.  The only down fall is there is usually a tons of kids which can be annoying.

V99bs7z931-ZmaXlI7qixQ.text: I came in thinking it was more of a bar than a restaurant... but was definitely a restaurant. A family restaurant. There isn't anything wrong with that, just not what I expected.  The hostess was nice. On a busy Friday night, was seated in about 10 to 15 minutes, not so bad.  Loved the big 18 ounce beers in huge goblets. Although, there is not too much on tap. Good onion rings. Pretty awesome build-your-own-burger. It was okay, but after dinner we were definitely ready to leave and go out to a bar.

UZciIiXh4I2yldJ0whFVqg.text: After reading some reviews of my sweet, sweet Arcadia Tavern, I had to write to set the record straight.  If you haven't been here, go.  It's not the  most amazing bar in the world, it's not the most delicious food in the world, but it's a great, fun neighborhood bar (that's clean, open, airy, busy and non-pub'ish)...I read some reviews where people said the kids really bothered them.  I'm 27, don't have children, don't particularly like dealing with children (especially while I'm downing 15 ketel/sodas) but I can honestly say that I've never been bothered by kids at this place.  Yes, there's a corner of the restaurant that has a Wii.  Big deal.  The kids sit and play Wii and don't bother me...didn't really even register with me that this place is "kid friendly"  I usually sit at the bar or the bar area and drink their lovely fishbowl Dos Equis until I get hungry enough to order their wings or hummus platter.  I've had quite a few entrees too, including the caprese sandwich, chicken sandwich & spaghetti.  All were good.  Not great, sure, but most entrees are about $10...no big loss.    We usually start out here pre-drinking before we head to Scottsdale or some other overly-expensive bar.  Great place to go with co-workers or to watch a PAC-10/Big 10 (they have both sets of helmets at the bar)  game.

a0WW3Ctd-1NTW2MkyVnznQ.text: Just arrived nice place not overly friendly server in the bar this wendsday   more concerned with texting , next up food ????? I ordered the burger 2 paddies  with a couple slices of cheese  and the sweet potato tots the food was 4 stars the  server 1 star ...you know what if your crabby go home

tGI1chYWeMcykBaSl1xZIg.text: Went there for first time last Sunday. Food overpriced and not very good. Owner walks around bossing staff and basically is over bearing. It was a real turn off. We know he was the owner because for some reason he came to our table and told us. Only upside was our server was nice. Don't waste your time. Won't go back!

wmt8eBr0sFYN6Vqkb5DUoA.text: "What sliders do you recommend?" Said I.  "Sirloin are good."  ...so I get Sirloin. They were mediocre at best. And $14!!! At happy hour!  Uncool. Don't recommend and mediocre service at best.  Won't be back.

UVDgaTchFbr7jrjLhW6i7A.text: Nice people and used to have a pretty good steak sandwich. Hadn't eaten there in a while and we just went in for happy hour. Sliders and nachos don't stand up to other good barfood in the area, even at happy hour prices. Acoustics always seem really loud. It's a sports bar.

j5-DRB1EV8fssyjSxJG2lA.text: Solid spot in the heart of Arcadia.  Food is always good - I've had their wings, mozzarella sticks, nachos, and the buffalo chicken wrap. If you are blue cheese dunker when it comes to wings, this place has AMAZING blue cheese dressing with ginormous cheese chunks in the dressing. Hello calories!  Also, the nachos are MASSIVE. I made the sorry mistake of ordering them just for myself as an entree and tried to eat half of it. Definitely an uphill battle.. no pun intended.. it's literally a hill of nachos.  We've found service to be a bit spotty. A couple times we've had to flag down a waitress for refills or another round of beers.  Parking can be a bit of a mess. Go buy a lottery ticket if you happen to find a parking spot during dinner hour here because that is something that very rarely happens.  Sports bar type of atmosphere. One side of the restaurant has 3 huge screens on the wall - excellent for game watching!

tXmdcCrgi3oTUrr6Gb77jA.text: Great food family friendly   John the manager over the top nice.  My new fav spot.  UFC night here we come.  Great TVs.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great food and service from John! Over the top management.

PgaVkDgcEZIGU_-40YMGIw.text: Stopped in for lunch, valet parking during the day is a little much especially when the valet only moves the car 5 feet. The food is excellent, great wings, great Cesar salad, prices are a tad steep, especially for lunch. Tons of TV's , probably great when a game is on. Four stars, I'll be back.

rbta18oasUVX9VO1dp_3Vg.text: I had high hopes for this place. It's in a great location, valet service, clean bar, etc. However, the two times I tried it, it wasn't that great.  I ordered a sandwhich and fries to go from this place, and it was just okay. Not that great of flavor and kind of greasy.   The second time I came, I pulled up to valet to which I encountered an awkward delay for a valet guy to come up, I didn't really know what to do, where he was or when he was coming.  In addition to that, when I came in, I ordered a harp beer. It was good, the ambiance was fine, it wasn't that busy. But when I asked for the check, the bartender nodded, and while I thought it was going to be provided right away, she was stalling doing different things, initiating conversations with fellow bar goers and even flirting with the guy next to me. It would be one thing if I was still working on my beer, but I had been finished by then. Then when she looked at me after flirting with the guy, she went from giddy to annoyed resting face instantly which I thought was pathetic.   After reviewing through multiple reviews, it appears to be a trend that this bartender repeats this type of behavior, the to go orders are not good and parking is a hassle which is always a relief to know that I am not the only one experiencing this pattern.   Given my experiences, I really do not care to come back.

YBOQSZq6AYNI_vezXxEKMg.text: Good food and beer! Burger was huge! Beers on tap $3.50 all day all night! Wings were very tasty too.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings were tasty crispy on edges with just right amount of zing.
Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon blue burger-has bacon, blue cheese, avocado and grilled onions too! Huge!

9remzxpRC8miGSouWzkcVQ.text: So, I bought a Groupon for Arcadia Tavern. I vaguely remember going to Arcadia Tavern with friends a few years ago for beers and appetizers and had a pleasant time. So I thought I would go back and try out some more food.  The first time we tried going on a Saturday night. Several college games were playing, including ASU and UofA. My husband and I thought we would go watch the ASU game and try out the food at Arcadia Tavern. First the parking: My husband dropped me off to get a table while he tried to find parking and to avoid valet. Valet at a sports bar?? Really? While he was looking for parking, I attempted to get a table. I was told at the front that I could not get a table with just 2 of us on college game nights. We would have to share a table with other people. I was looking around and saw several empty tables. So then, I walked around the bar to look for 2 empty spots and had no luck. I noticed most of the TVs had the UofA game, some had other college games, and no TVs were playing ASU. Which is fine... I understand this is a UofA bar and hopefully I wouldn't get flack for wanting to change one of the TVs to ASU. But as I was walking back to the entrance a couple patrons started booing me very loudly, I assume because I was wearing an ASU shirt. A couple servers were there and just smiled. Classy....   So we left, drove 30 minutes to Santisi Brothers where there is no pretentious valet parking, plenty of TVs, cheap cocktails and beer, and the best calzones in Phoenix. I didn't even want to return to Arcadia Tavern. If my review ended now, I would give one star.  But we decided to return after football season. This time, they actually sat us at a table. We started with the pretzels and cheese sauce which were pretty good. My husband had the Reuben sandwich, which he enjoyed. I had the veggie burger. I was excited because it was well reviewed but I was disappointed. It was too big, so it was mushy and undercooked in the middle. I didn't care for the flavor and the texture. I did however, really enjoy the tater tots.  Service was okay. Our server was really nice but was not attentive at times. After we got our food, we had to wait another 5 minutes for silverware. We had to flag down another server for the silverware.   Overall, Arcadia Tavern redeemed itself from that first experience. I am willing to go back and try other menu items. But not during college games...

k1Itr-loglbT3-kOq4OU8A.text: If it was okay. The atmosphere good. The waitress not so great. Plus she assumed over a 30% tip for her mediocre service. Beware!

ILZ7jJTN2JaoZTypifHXjg.text: I've been here at night a few times before so I was expecting the same amazing service. Walked in and had to stare the hostess down in order for her to help us. Then she basically looked around and asked where we wanted to sit and quickly said no when we picked out a booth. Apparently the booths were reserved so if we did sit in them we had 45 mins. to eat and get out.   Aside from that the breakfast menu was simple and inexpensive. I ordered a breakfast sandwich that came with a side of country style potatoes and a bloody Mary. I wasn't too excited about the sandwich but that is only because I'm not a huge fan of breakfast food. (Unless I am hungover, then its on!)   I actually really like it here. The manager usually comes by and talks to us and I love their salads. It seems like we might have been there too early. I guess I will just stick to eating and drinking here in the evenings.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich
Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary

jMnU12ENsRnTp6dvBbXH3g.text: Came here after work and luckily the basketball finals was just starting. Huge TVs everywhere. Highly recommend the Ring of Fire Burger, to all my spicy jalepeno lovers! And I fell in love with their Scottsdale Blonde beer; soooo smooth, light, and crispy. Overall a super chill place to eat drink and enjoy sports. Our waiter Mickey was very helpful and friendly as it was our first time there.

jDaee2Fr0zaJowt7GhFhTg.text: I used to come here all the time for football. Good space and location.  But the service has gone so far down hill.  Good luck getting a person on staff to look at you within the first hour you arrive.  If you want to just sit and watch the games, it's fine.  If you want to drink or eat while you watch football, go somewhere else.  Plenty of better options in the neighborhood.

MAeClWAwE0u_WVovbadZjA.text: We came on a Saturday night around 8pm with 12 of us.  The wait was 1 hour, but the outside patio was available.  No problem!  We sat in the outside patio and our server came by quickly.  She took our drink orders and came back with drinks pretty fast.  Then she took our food order.  While we were waiting sprinkles of rain, dust, and leaves came our way and into some of our drinks and appetizers.  We moved our party inside and Arcadia Tavern was helpful.    I ordered my prime dip with french fries.  The prime dip was pretty good and I am not sure how the fries tasted because I got tater tots.  It was a super busy night, so I did not want to say anything.  The tater tots were ok, I am not too much of a fan.

nhMWvFFbplmNHFDnpw-Cmw.text: A great, great place to have a ball whilst watching (and participating in) some GOLDFISH racing...  That's right, I was here on a Thursday night with a pretty big group of peeps (about 8) just hanging out grabing some brews, when we hear..Goldfish racing.  Immediately intrigued, we went over to get the scoop.  GoldFish Scoop: Pick a fish, name the fish, get a straw to blow bubbles at your fish.  That's it...you blow bubbles to "inspire" your fish and race away.    They have good drinks and most people are around the age of post grads and it has a good vibe to it.  It's awesome and I'm joining in the fun again, and again...

cruIdigkABomRQmQAi4pBQ.text: So, last night I went to Arcadia Tavern to get two burgers. One was a turkey burger with lettuce, onions, thousand Island and Swiss only. The other burger was a hangover burger. I usually don't check my order before I leave, but I did this time. The turkey burger was all wrong. I brought this to the attention of the manager and he not only did he correct it, but he also purchased me a free drink and threw in a gift card for my next visit. Talk about great customer service. This is why my family visits Arcadia Tavern so often. Thank you so much!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My babe and I getting a pre birthday meal.

ROQxd-E4UlHrHAh52aDDig.text: My rating is going to be food-based, alone. As I haven't ordered a drink here, or come out for a weekend, night scene.  I ordered the turkey club. 5 stars! It doesn't come with a million layers of bread which is a huge turn off for me at many other restaurants. Too much bread makes it all taste so dry and hard to eat. This one comes with avocado which gives it a creamy taste.   Get the sweet potato tater tots! mmmmmm (actually all of their french fries are good).  The reason for the four stars... their service BLOWS!  I have never, once, had a good server. Get it together.

GJrIGAWVMSridCh9bDVX-w.text: My first visit was Sat 10/1/16 and most likely will be my last. First of all, the parking is all Valet, which is just ok. Once you get into the parking lot, you have no other choice. We got there early enough to watch Louisville vs Clemson. Got a great seats. Ordered appetizers, few drinks and dinner. 4th quarter they changed all the TV's, but 1 small one, to the UofA game. That one small one was ASU.  Apparently the UofA Alum bought out the entire bar (TV's)! Not only did they not inform us, so signs posted, no warning this would happen, heck the waitress didn't even know what was going on until we complained. We moved to another table full of Louisville fans and watched the last 10 min on an iPhone!  Had we known, we would have had the opportunity to go elsewhere, right out the get go!  Pretty crappy that they roped us in and ruined our football night. Piss poor management.

tqZEgAByjd0T7O4TB6LNpA.text: Pretty decent neighborhood type of place.  Burger, fries etc.  They have a better than average beer tap list.  Service was friendly and make sure to bring a couple bucks for the "complimentary" valet parking.

bVp1lNx1-Drx3LQs4RsSGg.text: Great lunch spot.  Good variety on menu and food is pretty great.  Highly recommend the Cobb salad. It's generously portioned and I actually uttered the words "there's just too much bacon!"   Complementary valet is pretty nice too. The valet even remembered us from a visit two weeks prior.   Really good value for the money.  Highly recommend.

-BQauPCKyWmjrptzqqR13w.text: I like how they have free valet parking. Just pull up, tip the man a couple bucks and leave it up to them to find parking for you and park it. Love the atmosphere also love how they are a very kid-friendly place. they will provide a tablet in case you forgot to bring something to entertain your kids with. As for the food, good Wings good pizza and odly, good french fries. It's been awhile since I've been here but I think they also have live bands in their outdoor patio on the weekends.

8TuDyAZCFGgugeCu8a20eQ.text: This was an interesting dining experience for me. We went for the ASU Mizzu game (GO DEVILS!) From the moment that I walked in the door, I noticed that I was getting, once again, here's that term... "eye fucked" by one of the servers (I'll call her Allie to protect the guilty... not really, that is her name). I'm fine with that, and in my years on Earth, I've discovered that not all women actually want to have sex with me if they look at me. I have experienced, as well, that women, servers, strippers, like to use their sexuality to make a buck or two.   When we moved to her section (it was a comfy booth, perfect for watching the game), the overt flirting, hair flipping, and eyeballing continued. As we dined, she would address only me, and not my girlfriend. Odd I thought. Midway through the 3rd quarter, I had had enough of the antics. I wanted to see if she was genuinely interested in me as a person, in all of my cuteness, or was just being overtly sexual and flirty to get me to leave her more money.   When she approached the table and asked if we wanted dessert, I made some snarky suggestion that she should be on the menu. It went all downhill from there. She went from hair flipping flirty to watching the table from a far distance. We lost all interaction with her. I enjoy a server that flirts and hair flips if the server can stand her ground, is fun, and can play along. I AM NOT interested in a woman/server being overtly sexual and flirtatious and playing games as a ploy to generate revenue. It irked me that she was so overtly sexual and then acted like I was completely inappropriate by making a remark to her. Ridiculous. It also irked me that she refused to give us attentive service after that interaction.    Generally, I really like this place. Food is great. Service is great. Fun environment. Family and kid friendly. Can the food stand on 4 stars without service? Nah. Can the service stand on 2 stars without good food? No. So, it's a 3.

RKYkNH5ecC7zwTDsO5gy6A.text: I had one beer here and a few of my friends tater tots. No complaints and the server was nice.

RSt_Q7XZNbMJGaoaNQiKbQ.text: Yes, the Staff is amazing: very conscientious, very friendly, and the General Manager, Tracy, stopped several times to chat with us.  The tots are AMAZING, but when I complained to Tracy that they must have been cooked in the same oil as the fish, he did not hesitate one second to offer us a second dish of sweet potato tots, on the house!  I was there with a friend for lunch, and the place was hopping with a good crowd.  It is a tavern like atmosphere but brighter, cleaner, and more welcoming!

qHf95LZQPkhMFxhIfTMMqQ.text: We have been coming to Arcadia tavern for years and I think tonight was the last time.  The food is good,  the beer is cold and the waitresses are cute, but holy cow,  you pay for it. When did a turkey sandwich become worth 15 bucks.  To substitute cheeses on my daughters meal from pepper jack to mozzarella was $2. Really? that should cost nothing. The thing that bugs me the most is the price of the drinks which most people don't ask the price on.  You expect a premium beer to be maybe 6 for a stein.  Nope 10 and you learn this at bill time.  Sorry I didn't ask. I am not a cheapskate but there is a tipping point where i feel gouged. This ain't Tavern On The Green and 3 adults and 2 kids should not cost $130. I hope Arcadia Tavern takes this to heart because feedback is valuable.  As far as i am concerned i will go to OHSO or Rehab Burger in Old Town.  Just as good and not nearly as spendy.

7H819BMxiXJ1VftDZiR7wA.text: I can't wait for fall evenings in football season where I can hop on my bike, scoot on over to Arcadia Tavern, order a big ass beer and watch the Vikes. Well ok, there is no such thing as a "fall evening" in Arizona cuz it's still in the 90s, my bike is broken and I'm not super crazy about the Vikings, but I will have a beer! This is the kind of place I could actually spend a couple of hours in to watch an exciting game over a few beers with my peeps. Super cool atmosphere. On the bar side.   On the other side...I can see how some people might be bothered by rambunctious children and pre-adolescents. Follow these simple directions: enter and turn right.   The food is decent. I had the "Roasted Veggie" Salad - there wasn't much that felt "roasted veggie" or fresh about it, but at least it's a lighter option for the meatless crowd. The jalapeno/cilantro hummus was excellent. The plain hummus was, well, plain. The pretzels tasted a little stadium-ish but the beer is a good solution for that. The waitstaff and bartenders are stellar. This will definitely be chalked up to "cool neighborhood joint" in a list-to-be.

ZKvgsBZCxechdYL-7dnzBQ.text: Bloody Mary's are awesome..service was great , roasted chicken very nice...

G52GOrLIhQuVBKGIxWyS-w.text: This is a really well done neighborhood tavern. The blend of family side versus bar side works really well. Tons of TVs to see the games. Menu has a great mix of really good dishes, far better than most taverns or pubs. Staff is very friendly, and the kids jerseys "retired" to the rafters are awesome.

5jrz84YVjuepVcYwdtHSxw.text: Late night happy hour pricing is great! Other then that a normal BIG sports bar. big out door patio for summer seating. Would be great for a birthday party or big gathering.

XUz16pWqQEU2HyGQp1Mi7A.text: Tater tots and pretzel bun burgers. YUM. This place has yet to disappoint. Parking is tricky even with valet but it always works out.

-hWwn5vvHeGv1dc5DoG-gw.text: Nice looking restaurant/bar on the inside.  Lost a star for the parking.  What a nightmare!  During the day, they convert all the spots in front of the restaurant to comp valet only, but u still should tip the driver right?  So basically you pay to park.  Lost another star for the prices.  Ridiculously high prices, wasn't even worth it WITH the groupon.  Had the $12 classic burger, no bacon or egg, just the usu lettuce cheese tomato, pickle n onion.  Plus the 10 wings for $11.  All  menu items were waaay too pricey for a sports bar.  Lots of tv's on the wall, one for each booth.  Service was great.  I had Pablo.  Rob the house chef threw down some delish eats.  Will never go back as there are tons of better, closer spots closeby.  I've had better burgers at smash, habit, and in n out.

Rbsf4nd8rLDG3vNwiwqk2A.text: I've only been to Arcadia Tavern once, but I love the atmosphere.  Tons and tons of TVs...if you are a sports fanatic, this place is totally for you.  There's not a bad seat in the whole joint.    I ordered the chicken wings and loved that they came grilled.  The wings weren't wimpy, they were nice and plump.  It was a great meal.    My boyfriend and I will definitely be back.  Who knows...it might be our Saturday hangout when college football season starts up again.

ky4hainF7tK8jcn2b-ElTQ.text: Love, love, love this place! Great atmosphere, great for large groups, casual and fun! Have been here a number of times, and have yet to be let down. Order the sweet potato tater tots! Oh my goodness! Life changing!!!

Ez0FemKHlGP5DgJUwSPoDA.text: Good place to watch football.....love the Ohio State flag and everything.  We'll come back now that we know not to expect amazing service.  Asked for waters with our beers, never got them.  Got the bruschetta ( which was pretty solid), but no plates.  Asked for plates, never got them so had to find some on another table.  Asked for another beer, never got it.    Everyone was drunk.  Which is fine, we had a few beers too, but it was Sunday at 1pm......  So anyway, the menu looks promising so I'm sure we'll come back at some point.  Just not anytime soon.

zAvVT_OMG4GnEah13H2gLA.text: Noisy!  Weekday lunch, by myself.  I regretted choosing to sit at the bar.  A group of guys, obviously regulars, were partying hard at lunchtime, and obviously didn't  care that they weren't the only ones in the place. Lunch?  A reuben unlike any other (white bread?) but a fine sandwich nonetheless and good onion rings. Then I became invisible.  After finishing, I got to watch the bartender work for twelve minutes, including teasing the guys at the bar, while I waited for my check.  Finally, I was able to wave her down and escape. Return?  No, but they've obviously got a good business going, so they won't care. I must add for some reason she bought my beer, thus, three stars instead of two.

dYU1utPV7rYVRjkLJEQYDQ.text: Arcadia Tavern is one of my top five favorite places to wash sports in the Valley. With a bar on the right side and restaurant style seating on the left side, it's a solid sports bar for either a family or young professionals looking to have some cocktails and bar food.  Since I am kid-less, I normally hang out on the right side. If people complain about walking into empty bars in the Valley, then head over to Arcadia Tavern because on a game night, chances are you won't be able to find an empty seat there. But don't let that deter you because it's worth staying for a seat to open up.   I like Arcadia Tavern for several types of occasions: if I'm looking for a place to watch the game, to have some food and drinks before going out or to eat lunch on a weekend afternoon. The patio is great and when the weather's nice, it's a must visit. Arcadia Tavern is in a random location within Arcadia but it's perfect neighborhood joint with so many houses nearby. Parking can be a bit tough so you might want to park across the street and walk.   As for food, this is your classic neighborhood bar so it has all American food. The burger is great and I normally go for the BBQ chicken sandwich. If you're a fan of nachos, give those a try.   So if you're looking for a neighborhood bar with TVs and a fun atmosphere, you should check out Arcadia Tavern.

bsKfFgTaZzdFVBYoTY4_zA.text: So this update is long overdue, since I've been here several more times in the last year and half since my initial review. I dropped my rating for a couple reasons.   Two things people rave about are the goblets and the food. Well the goblets are only good ice cold and it really sucks when you're served a beer in one that is room temp and then you see someone else getting one immediately after you, in an ice cold one. Is it because they're a regular and know the bartender by name and know their life story? I'm not sure. But wouldn't an icy goblet served to a non-regular be a good way to entice them to become a regular?   As for the food, it is pretty good for the most part. Above average for bar food. But I expect that here because it is more than just a bar. Families come here for dinner, which is why there's a separate dining room. The edamame is delicious. Sliders are good. Pizza is just average, but the thing that really threw me off were the chicken tenders. They had to have been the worst I've ever had. It wasn't even real chicken. It was merely pressed meat. You can get better ones at a fast food place.   However, I love that they have Abita Turbo Dog, among other beers. And that it's a place to cheer for the New Orleans Saints. Now if they had a good cup of seafood gumbo..........

zkfS8V12Q_CLj8qCRQTAuQ.text: Pleasantly surprised!  Had a horrible experience at OHSO across the street so we were very happy when we had a great experience here.  Service was wonderful, many drink selections, clean atmosphere, good music.  Will definitely be returning!

NrK9PnPHl_KDDLQRlfNplw.text: Talk about an attitude! The server whom i didn't catch a name from since she stood at our table for a nanosecond and disappeared every time asking us but not giving us a chance to talk  if we did or did not want something.  I am glad the boys only ordered drinks once here, since her attitude was just crazy we decided to leave after they paid for their tabs.

H4e_v-n4wHAVTQbknCAQaA.text: Nothing special here. The food was par, the service was par, the atmosphere was sub par. It was clean. I wouldn't return, only because I appreciate unique and original concepts to which this is not.

BkkBzZD9ccb4bf3n-wGAZA.text: great neighborhood sports bar - - gets busy and very restricted on parking

CW3zEaIPGnZNQBUw5ILm1g.text: A great place to either grab a beer and/or enjoy some comfort food. The set up is a little awkward; when you walk in the dining area and kids play area(?) with video games is on the left and the bar and patio are to the right so choose accordingly. It has a long bar with big tvs and all the standard beers. The burgers are really good--"juicey lucy" style with cheese on the inside of the burger-- and they serve tater tots as sides.

c29-4dl8MWq1yl5I5o4VaQ.text: I went in last Sunday night a couple friends for dinner and a few drinks , the manager came by are table to say hi , my buddy immediately ask for a game to be put on , it took less then 10 sec before it was on  . The food and service was great also . Keep up the great work .

e4Qd81Yf-u6n4x5OqSW4CQ.text: I come here for sporting events all the time. Arizona alumni club is here. The atmosphere is wonderful and food is good. I'm sad it's closing.

FPGn9DJsJp01Sgd0AuNIwg.text: Our waitress was so slow! Food was just whatever. But people don't come here for amazing food or service...they come to catch game on a gazillion tv's lined back-to-back and side-to-side throughout the restaurant, bar, patio. For that, it works pretty well. They need a bigger bathroom for a place this size though.

Vk3KHgi7nYSSPeYWki1RAg.text: Great place to sit at the bar and enjoy some tasty food and a beer while watching a Suns game.  Great atmosphere, super friendly servers as well as patrons and good food.  I tried the sliders and the hummus - both were delicious!  The only negative about this place is the valet...feels weird to valet your car at a sports bar.

hN9nHLZHy-YnRyZeFR0wyA.text: This. place. is the bomb.  Great happy hour, bartenders are always friendly and helpful, and if you go enough they'll remember who you are.  Chef Rob does an amazing job with the food on just about everything - some of my favorites are the Arcadian pizza and the California Chicken.  Oh - and if you like sweet potato, you have got to try the sweet potato tots.  You can die happy after you have these.    Crowd is pretty diverse, but everyone always, always gets along.  That, coupled with the great drink deals and awesome food, makes the Tavern a regular hang-out spot for sure.

G_y1_Cln5tYZEnRKidn_TA.text: Was this place a Chuck E Cheese before?  I tested Arcadia Tavern out for a mid-week happy hour and it was wall to wall kids.  Little kids.  This is not what I am looking for when I roll to a bar at the end of the day to booze-kill my horrible work week.  It's clearly their aim, however, as every table contained at least two kids and they have wiis and toys set up in a back area of the restaurant for them.  Legos and blocks flying all over the place.  They serve the draught beer in these absurdly oversized heavy margarita glasses.  I had to hold my glass with both hands just like the toddlers all around me.  I ordered chicken strips which I am positive came frozen from Costco.  A friend ordered the bruschetta board, the presentation of which was pretty awful but clearly a blatant rip on Postino.  I tried their salami and pesto (sounds familiar) and the mascarpone and prosciutto, neither was very impressive.  The server was forgetful and rather dotty, doing things like taking two out of three drink orders and suddenly walking away.  I couldn't get out of there fast enough.

N1J8I5nc2IjdaeMXcTysig.text: Absolutely love this bar, great for sports and entertainment. FOOD IS AMAZING. prices are fair. only reason it isn't a 5 star is because the service Iv had so far Is below average. in a 2 hour sitting period my server came to my table 2 times. once to get initial order, I asked for a menu and she never returned. I had to grab a menu from the front and she forgot to input my order when she did return so she gave me my meal for free for the wait. Had to go to bar to re fill my beer. If I return and I receive better service I will change this 4 star to a 5!

uVdqhQRSbG-dS8W8jERk4g.text: We like coming here to watch Nebraska football! Go Huskers! They usually have it over the loud speakers and we can get a straight on shot from most seats. It can get crowded for college football so we have been know to make reservations.  Service: Can be poor - be patient with them  Food: Fries are for sure frozen Margherita pizza is good (but not the best I have had) Really like the wings and salads  They have good beer choices and they serve large portions  Prices are decent for the food.  Kids: They have X-boxes and Wii games in a kids corner to keep them occupied, so if you don't like to have kids around while watching football you may want to go some where else.  Atmosphere: Comfy - big half circle booths and large picnic tables.  Four stars because we typically get poor service but we get to watch our game, eat decent food, and keep the kids occupied.

Xr9tejhyseTfQRzi9fi9Rg.text: We are regulars here, mostly due to the kid-friendly nature of this place and yet a decent experience for adults.  I've had the spaghetti, and its just ok.  The prime rib dip is yummy,  the pizza is disappointing, but you can never go wrong with the custom order chicken sandwiches.  Perfect! wine selection is good.  Kids choices are excellent and the free kid ice cream is a big plus.  The feel in this place is clean, and comfortable and not too stuffy.  Loud happy, yet not obnoxious.  Parking sucks, but just valet for a couple bucks tip.  great tvs and access from anywhere   and a nice play area for older kids.

88O-r5aJBow2AZeJhD6FiA.text: This is a very nice clean, family friendly sports bar. The food is fresh. I had the all American burger from their happy hour menu. I like my burgers medium rare, which is really hard to get right, but it is one way I judge the cooking staff. I emphasized the importance of my burger being bright red yet warm in the inside to our server. By the way the servers are very friendly and attentive. My burger comes and I cut in half; MAJOR FAIL. It was medium. My server insisted I not accept it and allow her to take it back. She returned with a new burger and it was done right.

sCZMHLBKb8d-CEBgkpHzXg.text: The food was pretty good for a bar, and the happy hour was decent. However, I was very irritated with the wait staff. Our particular server was attentive and prompt, but there were so many employees that seemed useless. During happy hour you would expect everyone to pull their own weight, but I noticed countless employees standing around like the world owes them something. I suppose I could have given at least four stars had I seen a sense of urgency with the lazy employees, who I'm guessing, based on their work ethic, voted for Obama.

mNM4Gd0QAGF5tmofHh8YQA.text: Awesome food...horrible service!!  Ordered chips and salsa which we didn't get and waited about 30 minutes to even get someone's attention so we could get our bill.

0lJf4HzSaytJ3WnF85gBUg.text: It is now my third time visiting Arcadia Tavern, service is always excellent, from the valet parking to the servers and bus people, they know you're there to have fun, they add to it! I have never been disappointed with their food, one can tell it's prepared with care, today I had there BLT, it was delicious, I'll be back for more fun and food!

3zGBcNa4vULia96DTSHvLw.text: Today was my first time at Arcadia Tavern after it was recommended to me by a friend. They said it was a nice place, so I decided to go clear to the other side of Phoenix just to meet someone for lunch and try it out.  And I have to say...  My guest and I were pleasantly greeted, and taken care of really well. :-) 5 out of 5 stars.  The blonde waitress there named Alli is one of the best servers I've ever had wait on me in the last 15 years.  The food was good, the atmosphere was pleasant (went during lunch today/wednesday afternoon around 3pm), and the price was as expected...but the service was outstanding and I made sure the tip reflected it. Well deserved.  The waitress was prompt, friendly, courteous, professional, kind, and very welcoming. It was more like going to an enjoyable event by the end than a regular visit to a restaurant, and I really liked that feeling. It was very comfortable.  The first impression is always the strongest and most lasting. For some it is good, for others not depending on the day and people I'm sure...but from the cook to the hospitality, everything was stellar today.  Thanks to the staff at Arcadia and to Alli for making it such a nice day there. Will definitely be back with others, and highly recommend.

-c3qR9TJMCwfzn9StOpuZg.text: I just found Arcadia Tavern and I loved it. The tavern is laid out with several different seating areas including an outdoor area. I was there during a very busy time, and it was well-staffed. I'd be surprised if there were any seat in the house that did not have an excellent view of the game. Great menu selections. My food came out quickly and was very tasty.  This was definitely a quality experience, and I highly recommend it.

8aLuB8R4fY91_KGKYinc0w.text: I have been to Arcadia tavern a lot. I used to like going for the tater tots (sweet and regular), good atmosphere, and the decent food, but now they charge $2 to sub tots for fries. This was a free option till recently. It's already on the higher end for lunch. The burgers are $12, and you usually have to valet. The additional $2 charge for tots is extreme. I know; I'm cheap, but if you add a soda and tip, you've got a $20 lunch.  Anyway, the increased prices, some spotty service I've had recently, and a couple of bad meals made me take this off the rotation.   If you do decide to go, I'd recommend the burgers or salads. I didn't like the bland $15 french dip. I also didn't care for the buffalo chicken wrap that was missing blue cheese. I mentioned the missing blue cheese to the waitress, but she insisted it was in there. I told her I couldn't see it or taste it, and I was sure it was not in my wrap. Once again she said it was in the wrap and then asked me if I wanted "more" blue cheese... Ugh, It seems like it would have been easier to just grab a side of blue cheese from the kitchen. Oh, well.

_r9yJWvHPAoNhYDi_rAUpA.text: Arcadia Tavern has a fun atmosphere with pretty average bar food and terrible parking. It's yet another Phoenix restaurant/bar where they try to force you into using valet even though they have an extremely tiny parking lot. There are some spots over by the dry cleaner that aren't valet, so don't be fooled.

A10xqai2ymgcIXEw7uJ1Ww.text: It's never a good sign when you wait 15 minutes for a server to come to you. I was greeted with "What would you like to drink" No hello, welcome, sorry for your wait.   Food was nothing to write home about. I had the California chicken sandwich and it was very salty.   This was my second time here and I won't return!

TCB2fNpCMeFhbxm8RS1oPw.text: 5 stars for the best nachos on this planet. The red pepper queso sauce on them, magical. Love that the chicken on the nachos is shaved thinly.... so perfectly compliment the chips.  LOVE!

ogagDLxBxdivsyK9tAF_Jg.text: New ownership. Changed the best thing on the menu which was the Arcadia Pizza and not for the better. They still have the great sausage. It's just sliced instead of chopped up. Also the crust is much thinner now more like a cracker than pizza crust. So bummed

75m8jlqF-iLiINaIM-cHOg.text: The worst service and cold sub-par food once it arrived. Kids running around. Only one game on

yAsC0bgwHsah-8F8OfGT0w.text: Good food. Terrible service. I want to like the place but the waitress ruined the experience. Our group of 6 was there for 3 hours for Sunday football and the entire time service was an issue. We had to ask the other server to find our waitress numerous times. 1 person in our group had to grab their own drink that was sitting at the well while the waitress was just sitting at the hostess station. Waitress also sat at a table and watched 1 person from our group arrive and she never came over to take their order until we asked her to. I can understand when a place is packed and someone's working hard but to be sitting and ignoring customers makes us never want to return. So unfortunate.

Me7_20xFj3oWxjj7srM_bA.text: I can't complain but I also struggle to find anything to really rave about. The food is mediocre and traditional/boring/safe. The drinks are priced competitively for the area and the bartenders are pretty receptive/quick. The place is covered in TVs and can get a little loud during bigger games, for good or bad. They seem to have a very strict rule about hiring attractive female bartenders, I don't think I've ever seen an exception to this rule in quite some time.

NQHXtp2zOnP0mLwiKIRmJw.text: I like to head here for U of Arizona events.  They do a great job accommodating and consolidating us on the patio.  However, the last few times I've been there the patio area is ridiculously understaffed.  At the last event I waited 45 minutes to order a tap beer!!!  I really wish management did a better job keeping tabs on U of A watch party events.  (fix this and I'll give you 2 more stars!!)  Anyway, the bar food here is great.  There's a large selection of salads, soups, and appetizers.  Happy hour is a great deal full of food and drink options.    I love that this Arcadia Tavern offers complementary valet parking due to restricted space.  Remember to tip your valet!!!!!

1AIbc3NiYwoKYPxkr0q7Gw.text: The Hangover Burger is hands down the best burger in town.... hot dog and nachos are amazing. Pretzel was a little too salty. Ambience is perfect! This would get 5-Stars if service was a lot speedier. Been there 3 times each time wait for refills takes forever... 4 stars are for food, cleanliness and ambiance.

8k3vEu2HBG_VRgSV9fd5hA.text: Came in for a few drinks with my boyfriend and some friends for his birthday and Veronica served us.. she was so awesome! Made us feel right at home! Her energy was spectacular and the conversation was great as well. Loved the service from her!!!

W2-NxvrhfoEZsQD1PW0xhQ.text: I am pleased to report that the Arcadia Tavern is under new management! I've witnessed it for myself and the place couldn't be more pleasant!  It's about time, I was starting to miss their food.  I hear Johnny is back, too.

OYIPXtTeIegh9J2TFtuQEA.text: This is a local watering hole, especially if you are a die hard Wildcat. And even if you are not, the locals don't bite and awfully playful on football Sundays. The best seating to me is at the bar where the shenanigans never run short with the regulars. Staff is incredibly friendly and sweet. I am a big fan of their gigantic Bloody Mary and draft beers. My fave items are the ahi tuna salad and sliders. If you're going to watch the games or pretend to, at least order the wings, naked with a side of all the sauces. You'll find right in :)  I am looking forward to returning after the remodel is complete and can't wait to enjoy football season at one of my fave local spots.

sAmyVxMY3io3OpMTacVttw.text: Really enjoyed this place on a Saturday night.  I ordered the burger with bacon and avacado (it had a fancy name I can't remember!) and it was absolutely delicious.  The bacon was cut thick and not overly crispy, while the chipotle mayo and bleu cheese "cooled" off and balanced the flavor of this burger.   A side salad is an option with burgers and sandwiches--albeit with a $2 up-charge.  Not bad, but as someone who prefers a healthier option to the standard fries, I like it when restaurants give you the salad option at no added cost.  The beer list is decent with local and seasonal brews on tap.  We ate out by the bar on the patio. Despite there being TVs with sporting events on, plus some road noise from Indian School Rd., it was an enjoyable evening and easy to hold a conversation. The patio has a very high hedgewall which helps to insulate it.  Arcadia Tavern also does Groupon and other promos from time to time, so definitely check into this beforehand if you're a stickler for a deal.   As most decent restaurants do along this corridor on Indian School, they have a valet parking service during peak hours. Personally I hate having valets touch my car under any circumstances.  Other people may appreciate this service.  So in summary--delicious American pub style food, nice patio, good atmosphere, reasonable price.  Highly recommend.

NBAE-OQ3FLSb_RNkxEvdHg.text: Placed an order over the telephone last night for pick up for the very first time based on a recommendation from my brother who lives nearby.. a very basic order of a full rack of ribs and some filet sliders and they told me it would be available for pickup in 45 minutes. I showed up to a very busy bar and was informed by one of the employees that they weren't selling ribs this evening but had my order of Sliders.  I began to question the employee that this could have been told to me while placing the phone order at which time an older gentleman who I believe to be the owner walked over and asked what was the problem.. the owner was obviously drunk and instead of apologizing and making this right only had one response and that was " we are not selling ribs tonight end of story"..   If you are placing a pickup order I recommend you verify with the employee that they have the food items you are ordering so that this doesn't happen to you when you pick up the order 45 minutes later hungry and at dinner time..  The owner can work on his customer service and probably stay off the sauce as it was only 6:00 at night and he was already drunk and rude. There are several other bars in that area that I would recommend to include JT's, OHSO or The Vig to avoid this mishap an experience with an ignorant owner.

QIi5aIJ_qWa7vhgOHtOT5w.text: Quick Summary:. Lousy Service, Warm Beer, Raw Chicken Wings served and a manager nowhere to be found!  If you are an Arizona Wildcat fan, don't be fooled by this place claiming to be a UofA bar... They advertise their specials for the football game on their Facebook page, but don't have the proper cable service to air it (apparently they can't get Pac-12 network).  After taking over 30 minutes just get a beer (which was warm) we finally got our appetizer, which turned out to be undercooked chicken wings (very obviously so).  When bringing this up and requesting to speak to a manager about all of our problems, the response we got was "He's behind the bar".  Never was he sent to our table.  When we then brought up our awful experience to an another employee, the response we got was "I don't even know what's going on in this place right now" in obvious frustration.  We arrived just after 6pm and watched the back dining area completely fill up in anticipation of the football game.  When we left right before 7, it was completely empty because everyone had left due to the many problems (bad service, bad food, no game, etc.). I know why the others left because we were all talking with one another about how bad things were here.  This place used to awesome, but not anymore.  This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a restaurant/bar.

9rTAWnqtN6D2F1A8K31ZWg.text: My husband was surprised that I wanted to go here for dinner because I don't typically eat at bars (although I do enjoy drinking at them).  But my interest was piqued by their self-reference as "family friendly."  I don't associate a tavern as a family destination, but those with the most kids sometimes need to drink the most.    We played it safe though and left our rugrats with grandpa.  Arcadia Tavern was True to their word - in addition to a kids menu, kids eat free on Mondays. And, in the back, there is a whole area designated to kids...with a television, video game console, activity table and play kitchen.  There were a lot of young kids there, all were well behaved, and happily eating and/or smearing ketchup on their face. That makes this place 1% mall play area.  My water glass came adorned with a cucumber.  I love having cucumbers in my water. That makes this place 1% spa.  The menu provides everything you would expect from a tavern...wings, burgers, french fries, sliders... but there were also some non-expected items, like numerous fresh salads.  They even had a grilled vegetable salad - that makes this place 1% farmers market.  I ordered the steak salad, which came on a huge bed of spinach, big chunks of well-seasoned steak, and marinated mushrooms.  My husband took the more manly approach and ordered some burger, covered in bacon,  covered in cheese. They also had thin-crust pizzas, bruschetta, and sliced ahi tuna.  At the end of the day though, it's still 97% a bar...but its pretty good bar food.  If you check in on Yelp, you get a $5 off coupon. However, you cannot use this coupon in conjunction with a Groupon, or the Kids Eat Free Monday.  I don't care for that policy, but if you don't have a Groupon or kids, then it works.

Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. cheesy burger
Photo of Arcadia Tavern - Phoenix, AZ, United States. they put a cucumber in your water!

QUNTdu_Qg7BVaHW4FtO9pg.text: I called ahead for take out to use up a $50 gift card before moving across the country. My order was waiting and sitting on the corner of the bar in a large brown paper bag when I arrived. I sat down at the bar to get the bartender's attention and felt ignored....forever. I got tired of waiting so I (rudely) waved my arms to get the bartender's attention. Why'd I have to do this?  The food was good. I had a full rack of ribs, french fries, honey chicken wings, Caesar salad and a coke....but didn't realize that the bartender forgot to give me a coke until I got home. Bummer- they owe me $3.

9XPtwAPfAXdgsYCXM29hCA.text: Not to sound harsh but the food should go straight from plate to trash.  Not worth the money.  Based on convenience I've been here more than I'd like to.   Just change your menu.  Do it.

mGOho7w8rBHLAfgr72-qMA.text: Went with friends who also work as servers to watch the Super Bowl after our shift. Server Veronica comes to the table and just said "hi." Then looks around awkwardly. She finally says "so do you want to order drinks??" after about 10 minutes of sitting there. She didn't pay any attention to us or explain anything about the specials or how the Bloody Mary bar they were featuring that day worked. She then comes back and says "so are you guys gonna order food?" We put our food order in. Our food cane out quickly but Veronica never can back to check up. When she finally does after our plates are cleared, we just asked for the check, anxious to get out of there. She comes back with the check and says "so are you like gonna split it or what?" She didn't have a bad attitude necessarily, but it was extremely awkward and rushed, and just an experience for overpriced food and drinks. Fortunately the bloody Mary's were insanely strong and the beer was cold. For $9 a piece I sure would hope so...

6ij2-OS26cepixjuHn5SWg.text: Little disappointed.  Service was good. BUT my wings were not wings ... they were ALL drums... dark meat.  Newsflash ... if you advertise wings, then have wings.  French fries ... gross.  McDonald's has better fries.

Ya_S4k8QMpq5D6P0B_0ZTQ.text: Waitresses suck, they don't check on you more than once every 45 minutes, and their tables outside were so dirty and dusty. horrible service.

wmUw4WV_oUeoVJqRa0JI6g.text: Very basic sports bar with an uninspired menu and atmosphere. Great staff members that were very friendly and accommodating.   I came to the Arcadia Tavern the other night with a party of six. I was happy that we were able to be seated right away, but we were given a pretty odd table that had an uncomfortable bench for us to sit on. By the end of the meal my back was killing me from the awkwardness of the bench.    I was disappointed to see the selection of beer was pretty limited and expensive for what they had to offer. Fortunately there was a $4 drink special going on Saturday night for a vodka drink or a Dos Equis draft. The Vodka Soda drinks were pretty good, but not nearly as strong as most in town (If you are wondering, I think The Crescent Ballroom has the strongest in town).  To order I settled on the Veggie Burger. It was a very good black bean burger that came with a side of fries. I opted to upgrade my side for $2 to try the sweet potato totes. This turned out to be a good call since the fries and regular totes were not very good. The burger itself, although delicious, was cooked at too high of a temperature. There were certain parts of the burger that were charred that I was forced to pick off.

ackOUIwEd3AK1FwgKGtKnw.text: Had a wonderful dinner after work. Cat our sever was very friendly and provided wonderful service. I ordered the hummus with chicken, it was delicious and the presentation was fantastic! My friends had the lettuce wraps and buffalo chicken sliders, they enjoyed them as well. We will definitely be back.
